subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit with Selenium-RC how to
msgSnippet: ... http://wiki.openqa.org/display/SEL/Getting+Started+with+Selenium+Core You can learn how to write Selenium Core tests by using the IDE to record tests and
messageBody:
On Mon, Feb 23, 2009 at 11:18 PM, majkic@... <majkic@...> wrote:

> Thanks for the reply.
>
> Could you supply some useful link?


http://wiki.openqa.org/display/SEL/Getting+Started+with+Selenium+Core

You can learn how to write Selenium Core tests by using the IDE to record
tests and then letting the IDE translate them to your language of choice --
like Java, C#, Ruby... However, you can learn some bad habits from that
as well. Like how to appropriately handle AJAX calls, etc. Our eLearning
album is focused on helping folks do real-world stuff, as we do in our own
testing using Se.

It also bears mentioning that we use Se for testing UI-specific stuff, not
domain logic. As always, when learning a new tool, be careful not to
overuse it.

--
best regards,
jk
